a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

div.p: Every student matters. Every moment counts.

span.p: The next board meeting will be held on Tuesday, May 5th at 5:30pm.

a.title: Go to comments for Board Meeting

div.p: We are pleased to announce that the yearly school registration process for Sheffield City Schools(SCS) has started and will be completed via an online service. The online registration will eliminate paper registration and you going to each school to register your child(ren) in the district.....

a.title: Go to comments for 2020 Online Registration Information & Instructions

img.alt: Sheffield teacher uses 3D printer to fight against the coronavirus

a.span: Sheffield teacher uses 3D printer to fight against the coronavirus

div.p: Jamie Smith is working every day making face shields for health care workers and first responders, as well as special face mask accessories for anyone in need...MORE

a.title: Go to comments for Sheffield teacher uses 3D printer to fight against the coronavirus

img.alt: Grab and Go Meals Distributed Every Monday and Wednesday

a.span: Grab and Go Meals Distributed Every Monday and Wednesday

div.p: Grab and Go meals will be distributed every Monday and Wednesday between the hours of 9:30 - 10:30 at Sheffield Jr. High School and Sheffield High School. Meals include a breakfast and a lunch.

a.title: Go to comments for Grab and Go Meals Distributed Every Monday and Wednesday

img.alt: Sarah Bailey SCS Teacher of The Year

a.span: Sarah Bailey SCS Teacher of The Year

div.p: Sheffield art instructor Sarah Bailey has been rec­ognized as Sheffield's Teacher of the Year for the 2019-2020 school year. Bailey, a Sheffield na­tive, has taught art for both Sheffield Junior High School and Sheffield High School for the past six years...MORE

a.title: Go to comments for Sarah Bailey SCS Teacher of The Year

img.alt: Three SCS teams place in first-ever robotics competition

a.span: Three SCS teams place in first-ever robotics competition

div.p: Three robotics teams from Sheffield City Schools placed during the University of North Alabama (UNA) Robotics Competition. The competition was attended by 80 teams and around 400 K-12 students from across central and north Alabama…MORE

a.title: Go to comments for Three SCS teams place in first-ever robotics competition

li.a: Sheffield Junior/ Senior High Schools Grading Periods
Threadgill Primary and Willson Schools Grading Periods
